span.p: School elections ballots were mailed April 15th. Please vote!

p.em: Click the image to download a printable PDF version of this fact sheet.

span.p: Students, Parents and Staff .. Governor Bullock has extended school closures through April 24th. We will continue to deliver meals and distance learning instruction during this time. Any questions should be directed to your specific school office, teacher websites or the Lincoln Building (535-8777 ext 110).

Please remember our regularly scheduled Spring Break starts Friday, April 10th and continues through Tuesday, April 14th. There will be no meals served during that time and we encourage everyone to enjoy a much needed break!

Please be aware Lewistown Public Schools will not be serving meals to the children in our community on scheduled non-school days. This includes the upcoming break on April 10th through the 14th. Also, beginning on Monday, April 6th, there will be additional items added to the meals to provide breakfast for children on the following day. Thank you for allowing your kids to eat with us!

Dear Parents and Guardians:
At this time we are postponing our Kindergarten Screening dates scheduled for April 1st and 2nd. We will look at rescheduling the screening later in the spring to ensure we have all our incoming kindergarten kids placed in classes for this fall. This is just a precaution to ensure the safety and welfare of our staff and all families involved.
If you have questions please contact Garfield School by phone, (406)535-2366, or email Mr. Lewis at mlewis@lewistown.k12.mt.us

img.alt: Online Resources from our School Counselors

span.p: Please take some time to check out our school counselors' websites. Mrs. LaRowe, Mrs. Jenness, Mrs. Majerus and Mrs. Durbin all have websites that can be accessed from the Teacher Webpages at each school. They have have included many great resources and helpful tips for navigating this surreal time. Our counselors are available daily for our students so please do not hesitate to reach out!

In support of our students and parents we have included a quick menu to access teacher and staff webpages. For more information, digital backpacks and school contact information please go to each school's webpage.

div.a: Safety Tips from LPS School Nurse Leisha Armstrong

span.p: Lewistown Public Schools are some of the best in the state and consistently stand out when compared to the state and national levels. A well-rounded curriculum, combined with an abundance of extracurricular offerings, provides a wealth of opportunities and experiences for youngsters as they make their first steps into the world.
In standardized achievement tests, our students consistently perform well above....
